channel.title: Copyright Laws
channel.description: Jagex is taking thier powers to the max with this. They're targetting any forum that has [b]thier[/b] code. Just watch what you guys post here. And hopefully we won't get F'd in the A like Kaitnieks, ect. was.

item.title: Copyright Laws
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

The problem about disclaimers such as telling jagex they cannot enter the site, is that if I remember correctly, they have to sign a letter agreeing to that.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Laws
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

moparisthebest:

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=96.msg7149#msg7149 date=1143570822]
"By entering and registering with this site you have agreed that you're not, in any way, assosiated with Jagex and/or its associates."

Add that into that there too.

thats already in the registration agreement [/quote]
Lol, oh. I didn't even read it

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Laws
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

kmb:

Hehe :D.

I have an idea for a disclaminer (took it off a torrent site):
"The administrator of this site (moparisthebest.com) cannot be held responsible for what its users post, or any other actions of its users. You may not use this site to distribute or download any material when you do not have the legal rights to do so. It is your own responsibility to adhere to these terms."

thats pretty good, im gonna use that

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Laws
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Bebemycat2:

To my understanding a Jagex is not allowed to acces any members-only sections of this site (this being one of them)
I believe it is some fair-trade law or somthing.

So if they try and sue Mopar with information that they got through signing up, it would be illegal, therefore making the case useless, and any Judge would have enough sense to throw the case out.

Plus, everyone should just post "thier" code on different websites.

Also, Mopar you should make some sort of terms and conditions, I'll explain more if you want me to.

Weird. I'm not sure how they figured Sbot3 was real. :\

Read full topic

Also, Mopar you should make some sort of terms and conditions, I'll explain more if you want me to.

[/quote]

make it so you have to sign up to see them forums then[/quote]

but then it wont be like kaitnieks, and ive never liked forums like that anyway (if it becomes a problem the client hacking boards "may" be hidden if your not signed in)

item.title: Copyright Laws
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Bebemycat2:

[quote author=jme_009 link=topic=96.msg1640#msg1640 date=1141330986]
The problem about terms and conditions or disclaimers are, Jagex has to agree to them with a authentic Signiture, no check boxes or anything.

About them not having legal access to hidden boards, that may be true, I have never heard of that before. But i suppose it possibly follows under the rule of a cop needing a search warrent to search a house.

Actuly that Cop and the warrent thing is a constitutional law
I think it is the 3rd or 4th Ammendment (Illegel search and siezure)[/quote]

You are forgeting the internet is different than law in the USA, it depends on where this server is, where jagex is, where Im at and who knows what else, im not a lawyer

Read full topic
